definitions.definition: To strike or bump (someone or something) out.
definitions.example: I accidentally knocked out the glass in my picture frame.

definitions.definition: To render unconscious, as by a blow to the head.
definitions.example: The boxer knocked out his opponent in the third round.
The allergy pill knocked him out for a good three hours.
Running errands all day really knocked him out.

definitions.definition: To complete, especially in haste; knock off.
definitions.example: They knocked out the entire project in one night.

definitions.definition: To cause a mechanism to become non-functional by damaging or destroying it.
definitions.example: The antitank gun knocked out the enemy tank.
The prisoner knocked out a message on the wall for the prisoner in the adjoining cell.

definitions.definition: To lose the scent of hounds in fox-hunting.
(Oxford University slang) To leave college after hoursâ€”after half-past ten at night when the doors has been locked.
